qas.question: In what year was Father Edward Sorin given two years to create a college?
Which individual offered land to Father Edward Sorin?
Which church was Father Edward Sorin representing?

answers.text: the Congregation of the Holy Cross

qas.question: On what date did brothers from Holy Cross arrive at the future location of Notre Dame?
Which structure was the first used for the purposes of the college?

answers.text: Father Stephen Badin's old log chapel

context: In <a0_0>1842<a0_0/>, the Bishop of Vincennes, <a1_0>Célestine Guynemer de la Hailandière<a1_0/>, offered land to Father Edward Sorin of <a2_0>the Congregation of the Holy Cross<a2_0/>, on the condition that he build a college in two years. Fr. Sorin arrived on the site with eight Holy Cross brothers from France and Ireland on <a3_0>November 26, 1842<a3_0/>, and began the school using <a4_0>Father Stephen Badin's old log chapel<a4_0/>. He soon erected additional buildings, including Old College, the first church, and the first main building. They immediately acquired two students and set about building additions to the campus.
